metadata.description: Hormone-triggered reflex cascades linking endocrine release to systemic responses.
metadata.notes: Focuses on hormone-mediated reflex modulation rather than continuous biomimetic hormone models.

cortisol.afferent: Hypothalamic-pituitary axis sensing limbic and circadian inputs.
cortisol.integration: Pituitary ACTH release driving adrenal cortex activation.
cortisol.effector: Metabolic mobilization and dampening of inflammatory reflexes.

adrenaline.afferent: Hypothalamic and brainstem detection of threat states.
adrenaline.integration: Preganglionic sympathetic output to adrenal medulla.
adrenaline.efferent: Circulating epinephrine acting on cardiovascular and metabolic targets.
adrenaline.effector: Enhanced cardiac output, bronchodilation, and glycogenolysis supporting survival reflexes.

insulin_glucagon.stimulus: Blood glucose deviations sensed by pancreatic islets.
insulin_glucagon.afferent: Beta and alpha cell glucose sensors.
insulin_glucagon.integration: Islet microcircuit adjusting insulin or glucagon release with autonomic feedback.
insulin_glucagon.effector: Promotion of glucose uptake or hepatic glucose output maintaining energy supply for reflex circuits.

oxytocin.stimulus: Nipple mechanoreceptor activation or social bonding cues.
oxytocin.afferent: Hypothalamic input from sensory and limbic pathways.
oxytocin.integration: Paraventricular and supraoptic nuclei releasing oxytocin via posterior pituitary.
oxytocin.efferent: Systemic oxytocin reaching mammary glands and uterus.
oxytocin.effector: Milk letdown and facilitation of uterine contractions.

vasopressin.stimulus: Increased plasma osmolality or decreased blood volume.
vasopressin.integration: Supraoptic nuclei modulating posterior pituitary release.
vasopressin.effector: Renal water reabsorption and vasoconstriction supporting blood pressure reflexes.
